main event: On December 12-15, 1957, approximately 15 persons observed a very bright light in the sky in Chitose, Hokkaido, Japan, which was tracked on ground radar.
interesting points: The sighting included a very bright light in the SSW direction that lasted for about 1 hour and 5 minutes, The object was visually observed and also intercepted via radar, but aircraft could not close in on it, A photograph purporting to show the same object was taken 2-3 days later, The light was extinguished at 0950Z after initially being detected at 0845Z, Conclusions of the sighting leaned towards it being an aircraft or a well-defined object.
sighted object: a very bright light in the sky
witness description: USAF personnel and observers tracking the object
